Description: Parts of large Attic black-figured pottery cup-skyphos (made up of four separate sections: a) one fragment, b) 15 fragments and added plaster, c) 6 fragments, d) one fragment). Interior glazed with reserved band at rim. Exterior: section a: wide black band around edge of rim, reserved below; trace of handle root and palmette tendril; section b: wide black band around edge of rim; below, from left, part of tendril and handle palmette; at right, black-figure decoration consisting of Dionysiac procession (from left, youth with cloak over arm and vine over shoulder, moving right, both arms extended; two maenads running to right and looking back with vines); at right, second handle palmette and tendril; dots as filling ornament; below, narrow black band above black zone; section c: black band around edge of rim; below, part of handle palmette; black-figure decoration consisting of youth with cloak over arm and vine over shoulder to right, and two maenads running to right, looking back, with vines; at right, second handle palmette and tendril; dots as filling ornament; below, single narrow black band above black zone; section d: glazed black around rim, reserved below, trace of handle palmette tendril.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Haimon Painter (manner of)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Musée du Louvre. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1527) (phase 3)
